publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5065 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Congratulations to Denmark—That the Parliament congratulates the country of Denmark, with a population of five million, on hosting the World Gymnastic Championships in Aarhus from 13 to 21 October 2006; notes that the games were a great success and a tremendous springboard for Denmark’s potential bid to host any future Olympic Games, and looks forward to the day when Scotland is able to show the same level of sporting ambition as the independent nation of Denmark.
S2M-5065 Congratulations to Denmark (lodged on 31 October 2006) Campbell Martin*, Rob Gibson*, Jim Mather*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Richard Lochhead*, Fergus Ewing*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-5065 Congratulations to Denmark (lodged on 31 October 2006) Stewart Stevenson*, Alex Neil*, Bruce Crawford*, Michael Matheson*

S2M-5065 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Congratulations to Denmark—That the Parliament congratulates the country of Denmark, with a population of five million, on hosting the World Gymnastic Championships in Aarhus from 13 to 21 October 2006; notes that the games were a great success and a tremendous springboard for Denmark’s potential bid to host any future Olympic Games, and looks forward to the day when Scotland is able to show the same level of sporting ambition as the independent nation of Denmark. Supported by: Campbell Martin, Rob Gibson, Jim Mather, Mr Adam Ingram, Richard Lochhead, Fergus Ewing, Roseanna Cunningham, Christine Grahame, Stewart Stevenson, Alex Neil, Bruce Crawford, Michael Matheson
S2M-5065 Congratulations to Denmark (lodged on 31 October 2006) Ms Sandra White*, Ms Maureen Watt*
S2M-5065 Congratulations to Denmark (lodged on 31 October 2006) Linda Fabiani*
